revised_title: Quenching Cross Sections for Thallium Resonance Radiation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the cross sections for quenching the resonance radiation of thallium atoms in various flames. They measured the fluorescence of thallium in hydrogen-oxygen flames diluted with different gases and calculated the quenching cross sections for several species. These cross sections were used to re-calculate the rate constants of reactions involving thallium, providing a better understanding of flame kinetics.
